title.narrative: Development and Delivery of Biofortified Crops at Scale

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to contribute to improved nutritional status of at least 6.5 million resource-poor women of child-bearing age, adolescent girls, and children under five in participating countries in Africa and Asia, specifically Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Kenya, Nigeria and Uganda. The project’s purpose is to develop and deliver biofortified sweetpotato varieties in these countries in an effective, efficient and equitable way; and to generate rigorous evidence and new knowledge that will stimulate and guide further investments in the utilization of biofortified crops for nutrition goals. The project pursues this objective through three outputs: (i) Developing new biofortified varieties of sweetpotato through existing breeding programmes; (ii) Supporting the development of new sustainable delivery models for scaling biofortified sweetpotato, including new public private partnerships and cost-effective delivery models in protracted crises environments; and (iii) Strengthening the evidence base on the impact of biofortified sweetpotato, and ensuring biofortification is included in international, regional, and national policies, plans, and programmes.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Dryland Agriculture, Bayero University

department.narrative: The Resilient Nutritious Sweetpotato Program for Africa, Asia and Haiti

job-title.narrative: Principal Investigator for the Development and Delivery of Biofortified Crops at Scale Project

title.narrative: CIP Proposal to DFID "Scaling Up Biofortification Through Sweetpotato" Programme Phase II 2019-2022

condition.narrative: Continuation of the MoU after Year 1 will be dependent upon satisfactory progress and value for money being achieved each previous year.

title.narrative: At least 6.7 million farm households are growing biofortified crops, and a total of at least 34.9 million people in farm and non-farm households are consuming biofortified foods by 2022.

description.narrative: Note that: 50% of the people will be in target groups that include women of reproductive age, under 5’s, and adolescent girls.

title.narrative: Number of people consuming biofortified foods (fresh and/or processed), in farm and non-farm households (at least 15% of this will be in fragile environments e.g. in DRC, Uganda and Nigeria).

baseline.value: 25.5 million people (in farm and non-farm households)

target.value: 600,000 (300,000 in target groups)

comment.narrative: Additional people above baseline consuming OFSP: 600,000 (300,000 in target groups)

target.value: 1,500,000 (750,000 in target groups)

comment.narrative: Additional people above baseline consuming OFSP: 1,500,000 (750,000 in target groups) of which 50,000 reached through humanitarian programs.

target.value: 2,400,000 (1,200,000 in target groups)

comment.narrative: Additional people consuming OFSP: 2,400,000 (1,200,000 in target groups) of which 500,000 reached through humanitarian programs

target.value: 3,000,000 (1,500,000 in target groups)

comment.narrative: Additional people consuming OFSP: 3,000,000 (1,500,000 in target groups) of which 750,000 reached through humanitarian programs

title.narrative: Number of farm households growing biofortified crops.

target.value: Additional 100,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 100,000 over baseline (10% in fragile contexts)

target.value: Additional 250,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 250,000 over baseline (20% in fragile contexts) of which 10,000 reached through humanitarian programs

target.value: Additional 400,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP

comment.narrative: Additional 400,000 over baseline (30% in fragile contexts) of which 100,000 reached through humanitarian programs.

target.value: Additional 500,000 farm households over baseline are growing OFSP (equivalent to 10% of CIP's global target)

comment.narrative: Additional 500,000 over baseline; (30% in fragile contexts) of which 150,000 reached through humanitarian programs.

title.narrative: Increased supply and demand for biofortified foods on the market.

Number of Value Chain Actors (aggregators, processors, retailers), that are utilizing harvested biofortified crops, disaggregated by size of enterprise (micro, small, medium and large) and type of product (fresh, processed).

comment.narrative: OFSP: Aggregators: 55; Processors: 15; Retailers: 350

target.value: Aggregators: 5, Processors: 5, Retailers: 10

comment.narrative: Above baseline: Aggregators: 5, Processors: 5, Retailers: 10

target.value: Aggregators: 10; Processors: 10; Retailers: 20

comment.narrative: Above baseline: Aggregators: 10, Processors: 10, Retailers: 20

target.value: Aggregators: 20; Processors: 20; Retailers: 30

comment.narrative: Above baseline: Aggregators: 20, Processors: 20, Retailers: 30

target.value: Increase by at least 12,000 MT over baseline

comment.narrative: Progress towards this indicator will be determined after baseline surveys have been conducted in target countries in mid-2020.

target.value: Increase by at least 18,000 MT over baseline
Increase by at least 25,000 MT over baseline
Increase by at least 30,000 MT over baseline

title.narrative: At least 8 new biofortified varieties of OFSP are released or recommended for release; and at least 15 varieties are registered in additional countries.
Number of new biofortified varieties developed and recommended for release.

target.value: 3 new OFSP clones recommended for release

actual.value: 3 new OFSP clones recommended for release

target.value: 4 new OFSP clones recommended for release (including at least 1 hybrid clone)
8 new OFSP clones recommended for release (including at least 2 hybrid clones)
8 new OFSP clones recommended for release (including at least 3 hybrid clones)

title.narrative: Number of released biofortified varieties exchanged and recommended for registration in additional countries.

baseline.value: 80 OFSP varieties released in CIP’s target countries

target.value: 5 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 1 of these recommended for registration

actual.value: 18 OFSP varieties exchanged and 2 (existing OFSP) varieties registered

comment.narrative: 2 existing OFSP varieties registered in Ethiopia & Kenya. In vitro plantlets of 18 OFSP varieties were exchanged with DR Congo for evaluation and subsequent registration.

target.value: 8 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 2 of these recommended for registration
12 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 3 of these recommended for registration
15 OFSP varieties exchanged and at least 4 of these recommended for registration

title.narrative: Increased production of biofortified crops.
Proportion of crop area that is allocated to biofortified varieties (increase over baseline).

comment.narrative: OFSP: at least 1% increase over baseline.
OFSP: at least 2% increase over baseline.
OFSP: at least 3% increase over baseline.
OFSP: at least 4% increase over baseline.

title.narrative: Quantity of biofortified seed acquired by farmers, disaggregated by source.

target.value: OFSP: 10 million additional vine cuttings over baseline

actual.value: OFSP: 3.3 million additional vine cuttings over baseline

comment.narrative: The target was not achieved for several reasons. Over 3 million total of OFSP vine cuttings distribution is not reflected in 2019. Secondly, there was a disruption of activities from the previous programme phase as CIP shifted emphasis to new countries: delays in co-design of delivery models in collaboration with government and implementing partners resulted in missing the main 2019 agricultural season in several countries.

target.value: OFSP: 40 million additional vine cuttings over baseline
OFSP: 65 million additional vine cuttings over baseline
OFSP: 80 million additional vine cuttings over baseline

target.value: OFSP: 100,000 households

comment.narrative: 75% of recipients were women

target.value: OFSP: 200,000 households
OFSP: 250,000 households

title.narrative: Quantity of biofortified crops produced, disaggregated by crop and country (calculated based on seed quantity and the average yield for each crop).

target.value: OFSP: Increase by at least 8,000 MT over baseline

comment.narrative: Due to delays in vine cuttings, OFSP roots production will commence in the next cropping season for Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Uganda.

target.value: OFSP: Increase by at least 32,000 MT over baseline
OFSP: Increase by at least 52,000 MT over baseline
OFSP: Increase by at least 64,000 MT over baseline

title.narrative: Strengthening and sharing the evidence on the impact of biofortified crops and the effectiveness of different delivery models.

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 2; Technical reports: 4

comment.narrative: Published research on delivery models fell below targets due to the recent pivot towards expanding research targets in this area and lag in publishing timeline; subsequent years are expected compensate for this shortfall.

target.value: Peer-reviewed: 3; Technical reports: 4
Peer-reviewed: 4; Technical reports: 5
Peer-reviewed: 4; Technical reports: 6

Peer-reviewed: 2; Policy briefs: 2; Study reports: 2

Peer-reviewed: 3; Policy briefs: 3; Study reports: 3

title.narrative: Improved micronutrient intake of an estimated 34.9 million people of which 17.5 million (50%) are women of child-bearing age, adolescent girls, and children under 5 in participating countries in Africa and South Asia.
Index of the frequency of consumption of selected micro-nutrient rich foods during the past 7 days among target groups.

target.value: 20% increase over baseline.

comment.narrative: Improvement of index of frequency of consumption of selected micro-nutrient rich foods in target communities. Consumption of Vitamin A: 20% increase over baseline.

title.narrative: Number of people that are moved from inadequate to adequate micronutrient intake status due to consumption of biofortified foods

target.value: 500,000 over the baseline
